title: How to give a senior leader feedback (without getting fired)
excerpt: There’s a right and wrong way to proceed. Here’s how to increase the chances your leader listens and takes action--while reducing the chance they feel threatened.

title: When your coworker does great work, tell their manager
Stand Out by Giving Feedback the Right Way
excerpt: Most managers suck at giving feedback — it’s too infrequent and not actionable enough.

title: The Appeal to the Stone Fallacy: When People Are Dismissive During Discussions
Beginner's Guide to Arguing Constructively
excerpt: How to turn arguments from vicious battles into productive dialogues.

title: What’s Your Listening Style?
excerpt: We may have learned that we need to let people speak without interrupting but taking turns talking does not truly denote listening. And unintentionally hijacking conversations to advise, inject humor, empathize, prioritize efficiency, or insert ourselves into the speaker’s narrative is often done with good intentions, but may instead disrupt the human connection we think we’re forging. Recognizing when to shift out of our habitual styles and consciously apply alternative styles of listening and responding may allow for more effective and meaningful interactions.

title: 4-Part Nonviolent Communication (NVC) - PuddleDancer Press
excerpt: Express and receive communication empathically using the four-part Nonviolent Communication process developed by Marshall B. Rosenberg, Ph.D.
